title: Padre Island National Seashore: Artist in Residence
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Artist in Residence            Artist in Residence         There is no limit to the inspiration an artist can find at Padre Island National Seashore. NPS Photos by Kyle Christensen (calico crab) and Jody Mays (dragonfly and lightning whelk hatchlings)  Artist-in-Residence at Padre Island National Seashore The Padre Island National Seashore Artist-in-Residence program offers a glimpse into the beauty of Padre Island to selected artists for a period up to 3 months. Over this time, artists will be surrounded by the natural world and allow it to inspire them and their work. Writers, painters, sculptors, composers, cinematographers, and other visual and performing artists are encouraged to apply for this opportunity. The goals of this program are to allow artists to form a deeper connection to the natural world and support the NPS mission of conservation and preservation. Accommodations Each selected artist will have the option of camping on the beach where the waves are footsteps away, camping at Malaquite Campground, or RV camping at the park's Volunteers-in-Parks (VIP) campground (limited availability). Tents and RV's are NOT provided and must be supplied by the artist. For those artists who bring their own RV to Padre Island National Seashore, a campsite with free hookups can be provided for a period up to 3 months. If the artist is local and not staying in the park, art supplies can be provided. Food, towels, and any personal amenities will need to be provided directly by the artist. The artist will also need to provide sleeping bags and pillows. Cell phone reception will be limited and there will be no internet available. Artists will have to arrange their own transportation to the park and provide all groceries and personal amenities. Applicants should be in good health and be prepared for insects such as ticks and mosquitoes. Eligibility -The Artist-in-Residence program offers both emerging and established artists of all mediums the opportunity to apply. -Applicants must be 18 years or older -All applicants must agree to abide by National Park Service rules How to Apply Artist must submit all application forms as instructed. To be considered for this program, please send by mail or e-mail to the address listed in the application.Applications are accepted throughout the year and residences are selected on a seasonal basis.
